reviews.review_msg: a good prof takes students... students opinions seriously but would hope she never waters down theories because of students' poor understanding...like her teaching philosophy...testing understanding not memory
i do very wellwith this prof. good one, relaxing class allow to speak
actually very kind person great prof, quite open minded about the final essay topic i talked to her once at her office, nicetoo.

Jie can be nice in lecture, but shes very strong (often bias) about what she teaches so she's not open-minded about other's opinions and challenges. She looks at you like you're dumb if you ask a question and she is bad at explaining important concepts. When you ask her for clarifications outside of class, she kinda shoos you away. Never again!
she is tough the midterm quiz was marked kind of hard but she is easygoing prof. and fun.the great thing about jie she encourages you to speak and you are not afraid to speak at class

enjoy the class so far--jie is a great a facilitator--the class presentation is especially fun. cannot believe this is 200 level class--she allows students to do a lot of independent work good for professional development.

Yes, a decent and brilliant prof. the open book final test is not easy. I would prfer close book test. the questions she gave are hard to answer--you cannot find answers and have to summarize or conceptualize. the time is limited. other than this,the course was fun. jie can be very funny.

Decent professor...the great part about her was that u didnt need to purchase a text for this course...she provides the material for you.  mt and final open book...expectations and criteria was decent...i got a C+ for not really doing anythinf so im pretty satisfied lolll...attendance is not mandatory jus show up a few times then itll be ok

great prof. very insightful. when I registered this course, I laughed about myself why I chose a China course. But it turned out such a great experience. It's not about China,Jie also taught about theories. very thought-provoking.

the person below nails it. I just took this same course with her. She was very generous, compassionate person. We were taken to the vancouver art gallery for a field trip--she paid for all the tickets. I mean come on, a prof. just for the students to learn more about China.  And her course offers not only about China but also great theories.

I read comments on this page and feel like that people could be so biased. I am not her favourite student but I do want to say Jie is probablay the most enthusiastic professor I have ever had so far at sfu. A very dynamic and super nice, even accommodating professor. I couldn't understand why people could say things like she gave bad looks?!

I would definitely follow this prof! She is very nice, helpful, patient, etc. Likes to talk and lets others talk as well. Some comments here mention her 'yelling' and/or being 'defensive' - I can't even imagine her with such behaviour; far from it! She is very open to differing opinions.

Honestly she was probably too nice and too accommodating students' needs. She was the very few professors who could constantly reviewed what she taught and gave a final review before final tests. Her tone may sound yelling at moments but I don't think she is bad-tempered. I'lltake another course with her.

She sent everything to students, her lecture slides, readings, which was very good, helpful, but it's really hard to understand all the concepts if you only study the slides. You have to come to her lectures, but you'll learn a lot. She worked hard to help students sincerely, which is very rare at this university. Sfu make sure to keep her.

She was nice and very accessible and patient especially when you went to her office hours. She answered emails very quickly. She not only taught about China but also useful theories. I even used the theories learned from her course in my assignments for other courses. I'd like to take other courses from this professor.
Good professor. She is very open to discussion and suggestion, creating a very open and healthy learning environment. I highly recommend this professor.

The two people below me nailed it.  Her lectures are not entirely clear and she does a poor job of explaining key concepts.  Classes aren't particularly well-planned either.  Will not take another class taught by her again. She does mark fairly though!

not open minded, short-tempered with students who "challenge" her statements, even though it's just a suggestion/opinion/thought. Her way or the highway..wouldn't take a class with her again. Lectures are brutal, content was difficult to understand under her wording sometimes, but she does mark easy.
Have some accent, good teaching though.
She will become one of the most enthusiastic professors at SFU. very helpful and pleasant professor. Cool.
